Posted By: NecroticNobody (9/23/2010 6:04:29 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Feebit, I think you fundamentally misunderstand what regeneration does. Regeneration replaces creature destruction, so it never happens. Read the reminder text on a regen creature: it says the next time this creature would be destroyed, it isn't, tap it and remove it from combat.  
  
The creature with regen would die to -1/-1 counters even when trying to regen because it would always regen with the counters on it, killing it immediately again.
posts.html:
Feebit, I think you fundamentally misunderstand what regeneration does. Regeneration replaces creature destruction, so it never happens. Read the reminder text on a regen creature: it says the next time this creature would be destroyed, it isn't, tap it and remove it from combat.

The creature with regen would die to -1/-1 counters even when trying to regen because it would always regen with the counters on it, killing it immediately again.

Posted By: GenericSuperhero (10/11/2010 4:13:58 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Anyone else think he looks more like a Zombie than a Skeleton? Very powerful creature, however I can't say I entirely agree with its mythic status. (I can kinda [see](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=189884) [why](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=190198) [though](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=205235).)  
Regeneration is extra useful on a creature with infect. The Haste ability doesn't really make much sense though, not only color-wise; if you put him out with only 5 mana he'll be attacking the next turn anyway, and after that it's useless.  
  
An infect deck can do perfectly fine without him, but having one certainly won't hurt... you!
posts.html:
Anyone else think he looks more like a Zombie than a Skeleton? Very powerful creature, however I can't say I entirely agree with its mythic status. (I can kinda see why though.)
Regeneration is extra useful on a creature with infect. The Haste ability doesn't really make much sense though, not only color-wise; if you put him out with only 5 mana he'll be attacking the next turn anyway, and after that it's useless.

An infect deck can do perfectly fine without him, but having one certainly won't hurt... you!

Posted By: IshubarashI (10/6/2010 11:59:21 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: When a creature has zero or less toughness it is put into its owner's graveyard as a state based effect, it's not a sacrifice or destruction, regenerate won't protect you, [Tajuru Preserver](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tajuru Preserver) won't protect you. Really it's the same type of effect as when a player loses the game for having no life.
posts.html:
When a creature has zero or less toughness it is put into its owner's graveyard as a state based effect, it's not a sacrifice or destruction, regenerate won't protect you, Tajuru Preserver won't protect you. Really it's the same type of effect as when a player loses the game for having no life.

posts.post_content: Maximillini86, It's even simpler than that as far as I know. Whenever a creature has 0 or less toughness, you are forced to sacrifice it, which you cannot ever regenerate from.
